name: arch::kernel::acpi::remapping::Drhd::from_bytes

ostd_pod::Pod::from_bytes.doc: Creates a new instance from the given bytes.

alloc::vec::Vec::<T>::new.doc:
Constructs a new, empty `Vec<T>`.

 The vector will not allocate until elements are pushed onto it.

 # Examples

 ```
 # #![allow(unused_mut)]
 let mut vec: Vec<i32> = Vec::new();
 ```

core::ops::Index::index.doc:
Performs the indexing (`container[index]`) operation.

 # Panics

 May panic if the index is out of bounds.

arch::kernel::acpi::remapping::DeviceSco.doc:
Parses a [`DeviceScope`] from a prefix of the bytes.

 # Panics

 This method may panic if the byte prefix does not represent a valid [`DeviceScope`].

alloc::vec::Vec::<T, A>::push.doc:
Appends an element to the back of a collection.

 # Panics

 Panics if the new capacity exceeds `isize::MAX` _bytes_.

 # Examples

 ```
 let mut vec = vec![1, 2];
 vec.push(3);
 assert_eq!(vec, [1, 2, 3]);
 ```

 # Time complexity

 Takes amortized *O*(1) time. If the vector's length would exceed its
 capacity after the push, *O*(*capacity*) time is taken to copy the
 vector's elements to a larger allocation. This expensive operation is
 offset by the *capacity* *O*(1) insertions it allows.
